CSImageViewer::GrayImageData

GrayImageData Class Reference

Class containing the actual pixel data for a gray image (one value per pixel). More...

Inheritance diagram for GrayImageData:

List of all members.

Public Member Functions

 GrayImageData (int[] unpacked, int w, int h)
 This ctor constructs a GrayImageData object from an array of gray pixel values and the width and height of the image. mOriginalData will be allocated and set to the pixel values in unpacked.
 GrayImageData (Bitmap oldBM, Color[] oldPalette, int bpp)
 Given a bitmap image and a palette (i.e., color lookup table used to translate scalar image values into other scalar gray values), this ctor reads the image data, uses the lookup table to store the pixel data in an array, and creates a displayable version of the image. mOriginalData will be allocated and set to the pixel values in the bitmap.
void unpacked_gray_to_display (int[] unpacked)
 This function takes an unpacked int array of gray pixel values (representing an entire image), and copies the values to mDisplayData (also representing an entire image). mDisplayImage is changed to these values as well. mOriginalData remains unchanged. Note that unpacked must be the same size as the original image (mW*mH).
int getGray (int row, int col)
 Given a pixel's row and column location, this function returns the gray pixel value.

Detailed Description

Class containing the actual pixel data for a gray image (one value per pixel).

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

GrayImageData (  int[]  unpacked,
int  w,
int  h
) 
 

This ctor constructs a GrayImageData object from an array of gray pixel values and the width and height of the image. mOriginalData will be allocated and set to the pixel values in unpacked.

Parameters:
unpacked unpacked array of gray values
w image width
h image height
Returns:
nothing (ctor)

GrayImageData (  Bitmap  oldBM,
Color[]  oldPalette,
int  bpp
) 
 

Given a bitmap image and a palette (i.e., color lookup table used to translate scalar image values into other scalar gray values), this ctor reads the image data, uses the lookup table to store the pixel data in an array, and creates a displayable version of the image. mOriginalData will be allocated and set to the pixel values in the bitmap.

Parameters:
oldBM bitmap image used to construct an instance of this class
oldPalette color lookup table
bpp bits-per-pixel
Returns:
nothing (ctor)

Member Function Documentation

int getGray (  int  row,
int  col
) 
 

Given a pixel's row and column location, this function returns the gray pixel value.

Parameters:
row image row
col image column
Returns:
the gray pixel value at that position.
Todo:
george: speed up indexing

void unpacked_gray_to_display (  int[]  unpacked  ) 
 

This function takes an unpacked int array of gray pixel values (representing an entire image), and copies the values to mDisplayData (also representing an entire image). mDisplayImage is changed to these values as well. mOriginalData remains unchanged. Note that unpacked must be the same size as the original image (mW*mH).

Parameters:
unpacked unpacked int array of gray values (all values must be in [0..255]
  • no scaling will occur in this function
  • only the least significant 8 bits will be used)
Returns:
nothing (void)
